title: Moving Objects Databases | Database & Mobile Computing Laboratory | University of Illinois at Chicago
text: The project, called Databases fOr MovINg Objects tracking (DOMINO), develops a prototype database system for tracking mobile units. It is described in the overview paper below. The project is partly supported by NSF Grants 0326284, 0513736, and 0209190. For a slide presentation of the project click here.

The project is directed by Ouri Wolfson. Other participants include graduate student Damian Roqueiro (DBLP entry), Venkatakumar Srinivasen, Leon Stenneth, Fatemeh Vafaee, Mayia Arun, Lei Zhang, and research scientist Dr. Bo Xu (DBLP entry).
Moving Objects Information Management: The Database Challenge
the Proceedings of the 5th Workshop on Next Generation Information Technologies and Systems (NGITS’2002), Dan Caesarea Hotel, Caesarea, Israel, June 25-26, 2002.
